At least our western media culture displays the entire spectrum of ideological bias's . Allowances are made so one can have access to the entire spectrum of "truths" on a search engine of choice. Dissenting comments don't disappear. The screen doesn't go blank when the harmony being sung doesn't conform to the melody chosen by one member of the choir.

Instead of concerns about how many lies it takes to make the truth it would be helpful to consider the words of another great philosopher who once said.... "One must take the log out of ones own eye before removing the spec from their brothers eye."

The difference - speaking from a UK perspective - is that in the West there is a free market for information. Of course there is bias in media sources and outlets in the West, but you can pick and choose according to your persuasion and politics. With the push of Chinese media (especially Xinhua) into Africa it is quite different - we are talking about one product, and a state-managed one at that, so you can't pick and choose to get the whole picture. In the international realm, Xinhua is a tool of the Chinese ministry of foreign affairs and will only present a pro-China picture (and there is no permitted alternative to this picture).

I'd like to hear of even a single country, western or otherwise, that has a media that's truly objective and non-partisan. The responsibility must ultimately rest on the shoulders of individual citizens to make an informed judgement because we live in an imperfect world. It's even harder to deduce the truth when you have only one government or interest group's point of view.

The article isn't "ridiculing" Chinese media, just pointing out how the Chinese government is operating outside of China and what its aims are. It's better to be aware of how China is steering international opinion and to what. Even our democratic allies in Europe and elsewhere pay careful attention to how the U.S. projects its power through various means.

Are MSNBC, Fox news and CNN free of "ideological" bias? Our own western media can't even be objective and non-partisan when reporting on our own countries. Do they have the right to ridicule others? And no, just because they report from all points of the spectrum doesn't mean that one can educe the "real" picture by looking at just the sum of their reports. Two lies don't combine to give the truth.
